definition: to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
to be clogged up/to be congested (traffic, computer network etc)
(of a warlord etc) to assemble one's personal army, thereby presenting a challenge to the central government

sentences.english: Short hair is gaining in popularity although men are supporting a variety of hairstyles.
sentences.chinese: 尽管男人们是不同发式的拥趸，短发却越来越受欢迎。

sentences.english: Whom do I try to clasp in my arms?Dreams can never be made captive.
sentences.chinese: 我曾试图把谁拥在臂弯？梦永远不可能被俘获。

sentences.english: Dozens of Spanish beauties clamoured to get close to their idol.
sentences.chinese: 无数的西班牙美女顿时尖叫，拥过去接近她们的偶像。

sentences.english: His fans even began calling themselves Vayniacs.
sentences.chinese: 他的拥趸甚至开始以“沃伊脑残粉”自称。

sentences.english: The Wang Wen in bank hold office is Bao Hao this of furniture faithful embrace wholesale.
sentences.chinese: 在银行供职的王文是包豪斯家具的忠实拥趸。

sentences.english: In my arms for one last time.
He likes to surround himself with amusing people.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢让自己身边拥着有趣的人们。

sentences.english: The bank of the Ganges welcomed me into its lap like a friend of a former birth.
sentences.chinese: 恒河河岸就像我前生前世的老友一样拥我入怀。

sentences.english: The three types of youth have their own fans.
sentences.chinese: 三种青年都有各自的拥趸者。

sentences.english: Fans were delighted to see their heroes riding with the hoi polloi .
sentences.chinese: 拥趸们欣喜的看到他们的英雄们在和大家伙一起骑车。

sentences.english: Both are breakout businesses, with legions of devoted followers.
sentences.chinese: 两者的商业模式都极具突破，拥有大批拥趸。

sentences.english: So when I feel sad, give me a hug, please.
sentences.chinese: 所以当我感动悲伤，请拥我入怀。

sentences.english: Please be careful not to bump into, push or move ahead of others in the queue. Also, the entire party must wait together.
sentences.chinese: 请不要推撞或挤拥其他来宾，也请勿超前或插队。

sentences.english: The children piled in as soon as the door opened.
sentences.chinese: 门一开孩子们就拥了进去。

sentences.english: I'll never hold her in my arms again.
sentences.chinese: 我再也无法拥她入怀了。

sentences.english: Hern and I sat at two corners of the porch face to face, holding our blanket together.
sentences.chinese: 荷和我拥衾对坐，在廊子的两角，遥遥谈话。

definition: to push up one's sleeves/to reject or resist/to seize/to perturb/to steal
near/approaching/to depend on/(slang) to have an intimate relationship with sb/Taiwan pr. [pang2], [bang1], [bang4]
to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)
to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor
variant of 眷[juan4]/to care about/to look fondly on
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
